dataObjects.description: The species is known from the lower Mekong and Chao Phraya river drainages in Indochina (Ng 2002, Vidthayanon 2008).

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Habitat
dataObjects.title: Habitat and Ecology
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Ng, H.H. 2012. Bagrichthys majusculus. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Habitat and Ecology
The species inhabits larger streams and rivers, typically with turbid water and a sandy/muddy substrate. It feeds on crustaceans and other small benthic animals (Taki 1978) and spawns at the beginning of the rainy season in flooded riparian forests, with juveniles beginning to appear in August (Rainboth 1996).

Clear preference for deep water pools in dry season. (Baran et al. 2005).

Systems
  • Freshwater

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Conservation
dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Ng, H.H. 2012. Bagrichthys majusculus. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
DD
Data Deficient

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2012

Assessor/s
Ng, H.H.

Reviewer/s
Rainboth, W. & Allen, D.J.

Contributor/s
Fisher, J.

Justification
The species is considered uncommon or seasonal in the Mekong River drainage (Vidthayanon 2008, W. Rainboth pers. comm. 2011), but it is currently unclear whether this represents a natural scarcity or is the result of anthropogenic disturbance. Given our current lack of information concerning the population trends of this species and its vulnerability to anthropogenic disturbance, this species is assessed as Data Deficient.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Trends
dataObjects.title: Population
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Ng, H.H. 2012. Bagrichthys majusculus. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Population
There is no information on the population and its trends for this species, but it is uncommonly encountered in the Mekong River drainage in Cambodia and Lao PDR (W. Rainboth pers. comm. 2011).

Population Trend
Unknown

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Threats
dataObjects.title: Threats
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Ng, H.H. 2012. Bagrichthys majusculus. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Major Threats
The threats to this species are unknown, since there is no information on the biology of this species and therefore the impact of potential threats (especially those of an anthropogenic nature) remains unknown. The current threats to aquatic biodiversity in all of its known distribution have also not been adequately identified.

dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Ng, H.H. 2012. Bagrichthys majusculus. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Conservation Actions
There is insufficient information on the distribution, biology and potential threats for this species. Catch data for this species are also needed.
